info.title: Bank Account Contract Lock Request
info.description:
A request to maintain locks on product features and transactions of a bank account contract. A lock request manages locks for features, bank account entries (transactions), direct debit mandates, creditor parties, and checks. A bank account contract lock request is based on an event type which can be maintained in customizing. This event type defines which objects can be locked and some default values.
You can use this API to create, query,read, update, or delete locks.

Comments: Bank Account Contract Bank Account Contract is a contract between a credit institute and customer, which is based on the request of a customer for opening a bank account and consists among others, the bank account type, account holder, general terms and conditions. Current Account Contract, Deposit Account Contract, and Loan Contract are types of Bank Account Contract. Remark: A prerequisite of the API is that business partner data is available in same system as the bank account contracts.The API queries data by the current date of a bank account contract. A Bank Account Contract Lock Request can be used for business transactions like death of account holder and checks lost.The service Bank Account Contract Lock Request is assigned to service group Transactional Banking.

x-sap-shortText: Manage lock requests related to business events like death of account holder or checks lost using this synchronous inbound service

post.summary: Create Bank Account Contract Lock Request
post.description: Is a request to create a bank account contract lock request

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description:
Is an identifier of a bank account contract lock request.  
Special characters like "-", "_", "*", "/" are not allowed.
Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator.
Constraint: BankAccountContractUUID is not allowed as filter in case of cross-navigation  (e.g. from Bank Account Contract Overview Retrieval). 
BDT: BankContractLockRequestID

LowerBoundaryAmount.title: Is the lower boundary amount for a bank account entry lock instruction.

UpperBoundaryAmount.title: Is the upper boundary amount for a bank account entry lock instruction.

com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.title: Bank Account Entry Lock Instruction
com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.description: A bank account entry lock instruction is an instruction to lock the creation of bank account entries on the bank account associated with the bank account contract.Use: A bank account entry lock instruction can be used to lock a bank payment transaction for a bank account. Remark: a) If LowerBoundaryAmount and UpperBoundaryAmount are not specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries regardless of their amount. b) If only LowerBounderyAmount is specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries with a higher amount than the LowerBounderyAmount. c) If only UpperBounderyAmount is specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries with a lower amount than the UpperBounderyAmount. d) If LowerBounderyAmount and UpperBoundaryAmount are specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries, where the amount is higher amount than the LowerBounderyAmount and lower than the UpperBounderyAmount.

BankPaymentTransactionLockInstructionCod.title: A coded representation for the instruction to lock the creation of bank payment transactions.

LowerBoundaryAmount.title: Is the lower boundary amount for a bank account entry lock instruction.

UpperBoundaryAmount.title: Is the upper boundary amount for a bank account entry lock instruction.

Remark: a) If LowerBoundaryAmount and UpperBoundaryAmount are not specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries regardless of their amount. b) If only LowerBounderyAmount is specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries with a higher amount than the LowerBounderyAmount. c) If only UpperBounderyAmount is specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries with a lower amount than the UpperBounderyAmount. d) If LowerBounderyAmount and UpperBoundaryAmount are specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries, where the amount is higher amount than the LowerBounderyAmount and lower than the UpperBounderyAmount.

Remark: a) If LowerBoundaryAmount and UpperBoundaryAmount are not specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries regardless of their amount. b) If only LowerBounderyAmount is specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries with a higher amount than the LowerBounderyAmount. c) If only UpperBounderyAmount is specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries with a lower amount than the UpperBounderyAmount. d) If LowerBounderyAmount and UpperBoundaryAmount are specified, the BankAccountEntryLockInstruction is applicable for all bank account entries, where the amount is higher amount than the LowerBounderyAmount and lower than the UpperBounderyAmount.

ChequeTypeCode.title: Is a coded representation of the type of a check.

com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.title: Cheque Lock Instruction
com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.description: Is an instruction to lock a check on the bank account associated with the bank account contract. A check is an instruction to a bank to debit the amount named from the check issuer's account when the check is presented and to pay it to the check recipient or credit the check recipient's account.

ChequeTypeCode.title: Is a coded representation of the type of a check.

CreditorPartyID.title: A unique identifier of a creditor party of direct debit mandate.
CreditorPartyID.description: Remark: Contains the Creditor Identification according AT-02 of the SEPA rulebooks.GDT: PartyID

CreditorPartyName.title: Name of a creditor party.
CreditorPartyName.description: Constraints: Only 140 characters are allowed.Remark: Contains the Creditor Name according AT-03 of the SEPA rulebooks. Only 70 characters are allowed according SEPA rulebooks. The corresponding element of an ISO 20022 allows 140 characters.GDT: 'LANGUAGEINDEPENDENT_EXTENDED_Name

DirectDebitMandateID.description: Remark: A direct debit mandate ID is unique in context of a creditor party ID (creditor identification). GDT: DirectDebitMandateID

CreditorPartyID.description: Remark: Contains the Creditor Identification according AT-02 of the SEPA rulebooks. GDT: PartyID

CreditorPartyName.title: Name of a creditor party.
CreditorPartyName.description: Constraints: Only 140 characters are allowed. Remark: Contains the Creditor Name according AT-03 of the SEPA rulebooks. Only 70 characters are allowed according SEPA rulebooks. The corresponding element of an ISO 20022 allows 140 characters. GDT: 'LANGUAGEINDEPENDENT_EXTENDED_Name

com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.title: Direct Debit Mandate Lock Instruction
com.sap.gateway.default.bankaccountcontr.description: Is an instruction to lock the direct debit mandate on the bank account associated with the bank account contract. The DirectDebitMandate is the authorisation given by a debtor to a creditor to initiate instructions to debit funds owed to the creditor from a specified account, and the authorisation to the debtor bank to comply with the instructions issued by the creditor.

CreditorPartyName.title: Name of a creditor party.

Only 70 characters are allowed according SEPA rulebooks. The corresponding element of an ISO 20022 allows 140 characters. GDT: 'LANGUAGEINDEPENDENT_EXTENDED_Name
